metadata.title: CVE-2021-4149 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in btrfs_alloc_tree_b in fs/btrfs/extent-tree.cin the Linux kernel due to an improper lock operation in btrfs. In thisflaw, a user with a local privilege may cause a denial of service (DOS) dueto a deadlock problem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4149` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194
linux-image-4.15.0-184-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-184.194
linux-image-4.15.0-184-lowlatency - 4.15.0-184.194
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-184-generic - 4.15.0-184.194
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-184-lowlatency - 4.15.0-184.194
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-92-generic - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-184.194').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2').
